From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.

str2: To go down, come down, either from the sky or from higher land, descend. From kata and the base of basis; to descend.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma

str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Beelzebul, a name of Satan, the chief of evil spirits. Of Chaldee origin; dung-god; Beelzebul, a name of Satan.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

An evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity. Neuter of a derivative of daimon; a d?Monic being; by extension a deity.

str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
